result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose F Ponce Gonzalez

defendant.name: Ponce Gonzalez, Jose F
defendant.address: 10927 W Wildwood Ln, Building 13, Apt 116, West Allis, WI 53227

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jose F Ponce Gonzalez appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Jose F Ponce Gonzalez.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Final pretrial conference held.  Parties remain in trial posture. Jury trial remains scheduled on 11/09/2022 in Branch 30.
Received and Filed. State's AMENDED Jury Instructions

Defendant Jose F Ponce Gonzalez appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Jose F Ponce Gonzalez.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar.  Any pretrial motions to be filed by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 30.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jose F Ponce Gonzalez in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense does not have discovery or offer and requests time to obtain information from State.
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jose F Ponce Gonzalez in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defendant does not qualify for SPD appointment. Court holds colloquy with defendant to see if he qualifies for court appoitned counsel. 
Court finds defendant does not qualify for court appoitned counsel and orders matter adjourned for another status. Case remains calendared in Br 30.  Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jose F Ponce Gonzalez
Current: 10927 W Wildwood Ln, Building 13, Apt 116, West Allis, WI 53227   (Effective: 06-16-2022)
Prior: 5821 West National Avenue, West Allis, WI 53214
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 30.

Defendant Jose F Ponce Gonzalez in court.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Jose F Ponce Gonzalez not in court.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/24/2022@230p
